Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: If you're using Windows with Putty and keep getting disconnects, try some of the hints on this page - Worked for me. https://superuser.com/questions/294824/putty-network-error-software-caused-connection-abort

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @PHBA2061 it's a matter of how quickly you receive the block to be notarized (height % 10) and how quickly you can agree with iguana peers

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so not just ping between participants but ping between miners as well

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Along with how quickly iguana can select a UTXO

Author: Alright#0419

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The slowest part of the process is selecting utxo, this was the first thing I optimised and is still the main thing. You need a good receive mask though otherwise not much happens as other nodes can't see you are there. The goal is to enter receive mask first by responding yo your peers first.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: How you go about that is up to you lol, I think I may add some comments to iguana for the places I found that seem to affect things and see what others can come up with.

Author: bitcross#0905
Content: @blackjok3r  Thanks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: My iguana basically just selects a utxo randomly without counting the entire wallet... Also `time komodo-cli listunspent > /dev/null` get that as fast as possible. A wallet with 700+ utxos will take longer than any meaningful ping time, and is usually the cause of a poor preforming node.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also we can speed up the rate at which iguana is checking the block heights, so it starts a round as quickly as possible after receiving the block.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But go too fast and u will crash your kmd daemon

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The other option we may have is to slow down the receive mask so that nodes have longer to respond... But it will hard fork the iguana consensus. This will result in a mor "fair" distribution of notarizations.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The most important thing is to not restart iguana... If yournnode is down it will be ignored by the other nodes for a while after restarting. Not sure how that works but its defiantly something that seems to happen, like some kind of banned mode... Doesn't appear to be anything that does that in the code though lol.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Connection to other notaries on the coin daemons isn't that important... I tried it. What I attempted was to connect my daemons only to nodes close to me to seen if that made a difference of how many notarizations that group of nodes made... In short it didn't make much diff at all.

Author: CrisF#3405

Content: not others

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: none for me

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You need to be starting your dpow state machine thread at the same time as min SIG's of other nodes.

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: no it's not me, it's Alright 's IP ğŸ˜ƒ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Then entre the receive mask the fastest... Which is pretty much utxo selection.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So you need the block at the same time as min SIG's of other nodes, then act on that at the same time as them, or even before them, which is how my iguana is able to preform better. Its waiting already for other nodes to join the round.

Content:
dont beleive so, iguana adds all nodes anyway, and the daemon is not that important. these chains have not many miners. So adding the miners would be the best strategy there I think... 
UTXOs in KMD wallet are the most important. `time komodo-cli listunspent > /dev/null`

Content: try to get that as fast as you can. that is the goal to have a good node
